bug.author: Christilut
bug.summary: [Bug] Output folder name ending with a dot
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h2>Description</denchmark-h>
The output folder name gets changed by Windows if the filename (before the extension) ends with a dot. For example, if the input filename is F.O.O..mp3 (notice 2 dots) then Spleeter will create a folder named F.O.O <denchmark-h:h2>Step to reproduce</denchmark-h>
Installed using conda
<denchmark-h:h2>Environment</denchmark-h>
OS Windows
Installation type Conda

comments.comment:
HI <denchmark-link:https://github.com/Christilut>@Christilut</denchmark-link>
Indeed, that's the normal Windows behavior. I'm afraid there's not much we can do here to change that.
